subject: NQ-2060-g2 in stand alone mode starts buzzing
query:
After a couple of days the amps start humming. Even with inputs removed. Checked load and for ground faults. None found. Cycle power and problem is gone. _x000D_
Installed exact same amp at site and it has worked flawlessly for weeks
response:
The humming noise after a couple of days is likely due to the Bogen E7000 system not being properly configured or initialized. It's possible that the station's settings are not optimized for the specific equipment and environment.

To resolve the issue, I recommend having Don review the station configuration and settings to ensure they are correct and optimized for the specific equipment installed. Additionally, it would be beneficial to perform a system reset or restart to ensure all settings are applied.

If the issue persists after reviewing and resetting the configuration, it may be worth considering replacing the amplifier to rule out any manufacturing defects. _x000D_

To fix the issue, verify that the SIP server address for the second campus is correctly configured on each of the Grandstream ht813s. Additionally, check that the Station configuration for each phone is identical except for the extension, as described in the query.

subject: Engineering question...
query: Putting together a Sound/Clock System for a school. Can I wire multiple speakers, each with a separate AT35A volume control, in parallel...basically from the same 25V line feed?
response:
Yes, you can wire multiple speakers in parallel from the same 25V line feed, as long as each speaker has its own AT35A volume control. This configuration allows each speaker to maintain individual volume adjustments while sharing the same power source.

To implement this setup:

1. Connect each speaker to the 25V power source using the appropriate wiring for the specific speaker type (e.g., 10/2 AWG speaker wire for 4-conductor speakers).
2. Ensure all speakers are configured for parallel wiring by verifying that the speakers’ terminals are properly labeled (e.g., one terminal for power ‘+

subject: ASB
query: All extensions dialed on this ASB produces an all call system wide.
response:
The issue arises due to the station type of the extensions being set to "Admin Phone" instead of "IP Phone." This configuration causes all calls made from those extensions to be routed as All Call pages.

To resolve the issue, navigate to the Admin Web UI, select Stations, and edit the desired extensions. Change the Type from "Admin Phone" to "IP Phone." After the change, all call functionality should be restored for those extensions. Ensure that the Call Switch Type is set to "Normal" and that the Extension is not excluded from paging in the Paging Exclusions parameter. If the issue persists, verify that the

subject: System down

fwrite(): write of 1965 bytes failed with errno=28 No space left on device

To resolve this issue, you should check the available disk space on the Nyquist System Controller to ensure that there is enough room for the system to operate. If the system is running low on space, you should delete any unnecessary files, clear the logs, or consider upgrading the disk space.

subject: System Controller nics dead

Nic lights up for 5 seconds on reboot but then link light cuts off. Unable to factory reset or access System Controller. Neither nic is working at all now.

The issue arises due to the Bogen E7000 system not being able to communicate with the Network Interface Cards (NICs) after the IP address change. This results in the inability to navigate, ping, or access the System Controller.

To resolve the issue, perform the following steps:

1. Reboot the System Controller to ensure all processes are stopped.
2. Using a network device (e.g., laptop), connect to the NICs using their new IP addresses to verify connectivity.
3. Once connected, check for any firmware updates for the NICs and apply them if necessary.

subject: port cross talk on ASB

It seems like there might be an issue with the wiring configuration for the Nyquist ASB port (22) that is causing the port to behave erratically when called. When the ASB port is paged, it attempts to call port 18, indicating that there may be some sort of misconfiguration or connection that is not properly set up.
The fact that the issue stopped when the wiring was moved from port 22 suggests that there is a problem with the wiring for that specific port. Additionally, the fact that the issue resumed when the wiring was replaced on port 22 further confirms this theory.

_x000D_

_x000D_

_x000D_

subject: All speakers all call

This was done on Friday and same thing is still happening today._x000D_
This system has been in since August of last year. The only change was made 2 weeks ago on 2 of 4 schools that were installed in district on 8/24. The 2 schools with the all call are the only 2 it is happening on. It was not happening previously._x000D_

It appears that the system is set up to broadcast calls to all speakers when a call is made from an admin phone in designated rooms. To resolve the issue, it is suggested that the All Call feature be disabled for those specific rooms. Additionally, it would be beneficial to review the station configuration to ensure that each station is set up correctly and that there are no empty spaces between speaker ports.

subject: applying admin group  to stations for rollover calls
query: I have a school that is fully configured with seven Analog Bridge devices. The school has now decided they want rollover for all the phones in the main office to occur. I have created the admin group and assigned the three admin phones to the group. The only place I have seen to deploy the admin group is under the settings of each station. I was wanting to know if there is an easier way to accomplish this task? How can I deploy the admin group on a Bridge or server level?
response:
I understand your concern about deploying the admin group across multiple stations. While it is possible to configure each station individually, there is an easier way to do so on the Bridge or server level.

To deploy the admin group across all stations in the main office, you can create a bridge station that serves as the admin bridge. This bridge station can be assigned to the admin group, allowing the admin phones to participate in the admin functionality without having to configure each station separately.

To create the admin bridge station, follow these steps:

Step 1: On the Bridge Devices page, select the Add icon to create a new bridge device.

subject: Reset Admin PW
query: Need to reset the admin PW as it has been changed and we no longer have access to the admin acct
response:
I understand your concern. If the admin password has been changed and you no longer have access to the admin account, you can reset it through the system's password reset feature.

To reset the admin password:

1. Log in to the E7000 system using the current admin credentials.
2. Navigate to System Parameters > Password Reset.
3. Select the Reset button next to the Admin account.
4. Enter a new password for the Admin account and confirm it.
5. Save the changes.

After resetting the password, you will need to log out and log back in to the system using the new password.

response:

Upon upgrading, it's recommended to reset the ASB devices to their default settings to ensure they are properly configured for the new firmware version. Additionally, verify that the ASBs are properly associated with the correct station type to prevent any functionality issues.

Action Items:

1. Power cycle the ASBs at the North campus to ensure they are fully powered off before proceeding.
2. Reset each ASB device to its default settings.
3. Verify that each ASB is properly associated with the correct station type

subject: Using a Nyquist Ver 7 Backup (with Patches 1 and 2) on Ver 9 Question
query:
Hi Guys - _x000D_
_x000D_
I have a early Bogen Nyquist adopter customer that currently has Nyquist Version 7 (w/ Patches 1 and 2) that is currently using their own server running Debian. They pay their software maintenance and are looking at keeping their system up to date - However, as you know performing updates with customer' provided hardware is significantly more difficult than if they used a Bogen Nyquist branded System Controller. I am hoping to sell them a hardware system controller to make this process easier - and have some questions about utilizing a backup from their existing system on Ver 9 (which is what you are shipping the Controller with now). Additionally I have questions on the possibility of moving their current Audio Songs and Playlists over (if possible).
response:
Hi there! I understand your concerns about updating the Bogen Nyquist system with patches and software maintenance. Using a hardware system controller can indeed simplify the update process for your customer.

To utilize a backup from their existing system on Version 9, you can follow these steps:

1. Ensure the customer's server is running the latest Debian version and the Nyquist software is updated to Version 9.
2. Create a backup of their current system using the built-in backup feature in the Nyquist web interface.
3. Transfer the backup file to the new hardware system controller.
4. Restore the backup on the new hardware system

subject: Sound Levels/ Talback and Bogen DDU250 push to talk mic troubleshoot
query: I recently did an upgrade of all firmware and controller software over spring break to resolve an issue i had with the call switches periodically going red and my teachers not being able to call out.  The secretary, oddly enough, could still make "all-calls" and I could get to web interface.  However, the teacher could not page the office.  Also, the conversations were not clear whenever either party made calls, especially if there is any type of chatter in the office, which is everyday at the beginning and end of the day during dropoff and pickup by parents.  Basicly have to tell anyone talking to be quiet, in order to have a 2 way conversation.  The teachers are back this morning so I've been testing of the effectiveness of the updates made.  The sound quality louder.  So far I've found one red button, but I was able to still call the office and it turned blue during the call.  I paged the office from a room, and the moment the principal began talking in the backroom of the office, t
response:
It seems that the issue may be related to the configuration of the call switches and the paging system after the firmware and controller software updates. The fact that the secretary could still make "all-calls" suggests that the call switch configuration may have been altered during the update process.

To resolve the issue, I recommend verifying the call switch configuration to ensure that it is set up correctly for the teachers to page the office. Additionally, it would be wise to check the paging system settings to confirm that the teachers are able to initiate paging to the office.

It's also important to investigate the cause of the poor sound quality during calls,

subject: need help adding a morning announcement wav file
query: I can not add a wav file to the start of day programming.
response:
I understand your concern about adding a wav file to the start of day programming in the Bogen E7000 system. To resolve this issue, ensure that you are in the appropriate zone for editing. 
To add a wav file, follow these steps:
Step 1: On the navigation bar, expand Audio.
Step 2: Select Audio Sources.
Step 3: On the Audio Sources page, select the Add icon.
Step 4: On the Add Source page, provide a name for the source, 
select the Type as Audio File, and navigate using the Select 
File icon to locate the wav file

subject: BOGEN NQ-PA120 Paging
query: When you make a page from the NQ-T1100 phone to a PA120 zone a recorded message plays saying that intercom is not available and the zone is page only. Is there any way to stop this message?
response:
The message you’re experiencing is due to the zone being designated as Page Only in the E7000 system. This means that the zone is not capable of receiving or making intercom calls. To stop this message from playing, you can either change the zone configuration to allow intercom calls or create a custom announcement to replace the default message. For further assistance or to modify zone settings, please contact Bogen Customer Support for guidance. 

Additional Tips:
• Ensure that the NQ-T1100 phone is properly configured to use the E7000 system features.
• Verify that the PA120 zone is set up correctly to

subject: I can't connect my yealink t48U phone to my system controller
query: I just don't know how to get the phone activated into the system and get it fully registered.
response:
To activate the phone into the system and get it fully registered, follow these steps:

Step 1: Ensure the phone is powered on and the screen is unlocked.

Step 2: On the phone’s display, select the Settings icon.

Step 3: Scroll down and select the Accounts option.

Step 4: Select the Register account option.

Step 5: Select the E7000 system server URL option and enter the server address, username, and password.

Step 6: Select Register.

Step 7: Wait for the registration process to complete. You will know it is done when the phone’s screen

subject: ntpd stopped trusting county provided time servers
query: I had a school that the time had drifted a while back.  Working with the county IT person, we discovered that the county time server was only using one IP to provide time.  This was corrected and now the system controller will get multiple addresses from the time server.  But my time was still not correcting.  After further research I have noticed that the "*" is set for the local machine. it was probably already preferring local host before they fixed the single time server issue on their end.  Restarting the system controller or changing to a public time server then back, and the * is still preferring local host for time.  I have changed to a public time server for now, but I'd like to get this ironed out. Seems to be across all our 7, 8, and 9 systems for this county. Thanks!
response:
The issue arises from the system controller's configuration being set to prefer the local machine for time synchronization, indicated by the "*" setting. Even after correcting the county time server to use multiple IP addresses, the system controller continues to rely on the local host for time. To resolve this, you should reset the time source to the network time server (NTS) by following these steps:

1. Access the System Parameters page on the Admin Web UI.
2. Scroll down to the Time Configuration section.
3. Set the NTS Address parameter to the desired NTS server.
4. Ensure the Auto-sync Time parameter is enabled.

subject: Adding a PBX integration
query: I am adding a pbx integration for a customer.  I have added the DISA extension and the admin group. The sip trunk has been added and I want to make sure what I have entered is correct
response:
To verify the settings for the DISA extension and the admin group for the pbx integration, follow these steps:
1. On the navigation bar, select System Parameters.
2. Under System Parameters, select DISA Parameters.
3. Verify that the DISA extension and the admin group are correctly set for the pbx integration. If necessary, make adjustments to these settings.
4. After making changes, select Save to apply the new settings.
5. To verify that the sip trunk is correctly configured for the pbx integration, select SIP Trunks.
6. Under SIP Trunks, select Add SIP Trunk.

subject: Phone's not updating time zone/DST correctly every spring.
query: I have systems on 7, 8, and 9.  They all seem to have a problem when we "spring forward".  I go into the phones and set the DST and time zone settings, and i don't hear anything when time changes in the fall.  But every spring I end up going through the phones and changing the DST and time zone settings again.  Is there a recommended setting that will not get overridden by auto provision?  Or maybe I'm doing something wrong here.  Thank you for any help or suggestions for settings.
response:
I understand your concern regarding the Bogen E7000 system's behavior during daylight saving time (DST) changes. It's frustrating to have to manually adjust the settings every spring.

1. Access the Admin Web UI by typing the IP address of your E7000 system server in your browser (usually 192.168.1.0 or 192.168.1.1).
2. Log in with your credentials (username and password).
3. Navigate to System Parameters >

subject: HTTPS Sessions full
query: School network management or security server is opening sessions with the Nyquist controller too frequently and filling the HTTPS Sessions table, preventing further logins. Table was cleared w/ root access in the CLI. If the offending server does not reduce the frequency of these attempted logins, this will reoccur.
response:
The issue is likely due to a misconfiguration or bug in the school network management or security server that is causing it to attempt to open too many sessions with the Nyquist controller. Clearing the HTTPS Sessions table via root access in the CLI is a temporary solution to prevent further logins, but it does not address the root cause of the problem.

To resolve the issue, the IT team should investigate and troubleshoot the server configuration to determine why it is opening so many sessions. This may involve reviewing server logs, configuration files, and network traffic to identify any errors or misconfigurations that are causing the problem. If necessary
